--- In gladiator@y..., "Rory Wilde" <laughingmadman@h...> wrote:
> one thing i don't understand about the Chain-Lightning, wouldn't it 
just 
> keep cycling throught the people it hits. like it leaves person 1, 
goes and 
> hits person 2. and because person 1 is still close enough, it jumps 
back to 
> him. and so on, untill 1 or 2 is dead.

I consider that part of the problem.  Chain-lightning shouldn't pass 
through a character unless the character dies because of 
chain-lightning.  I wonder how much time could be saved if you could 
turn off the chain-lightning graphic traveling from one character to 
another.  Another possibility is limit chain-lightning in such a way 
that one chain-lightning go after a single character at a time.  If 5 
chain-lightnings are going after a single character, combine them.

I just tried running chain lightning at speed setting 2, and well, it 
doesn't matter.  Handling 60 slime with chain-lightning seem to 
seriously slow it down.

I think it might be faster to go through the entire area effected 
(spelling?)looking for characters as opposed to looking at every 
character and checking coordinates.  Of course that might be 
impossible if the coding wasn't written for that.
